body:
I've split the bugfixes off as #7532, but I'm not convinced the approach used in #5969 is a great idea, since it blindly assumes that any non-column attribute should be treated like a boolean. (Thus, a string value in a `store_accessor` attribute that is set to 'No' will test as false, despite not being blank)

There's also a glaring bug in that code:

https://github.com/hube/rails/commit/ba9d940713dfb8c9ea84acf8b085bb733cb64d5d#L0R27

That references `attr_name`, which isn't even in scope since the method body was moved!

I'd say the question-mark accessor is a minor part of this; it's more about the incoming type-conversion to boolean, which could probably make good use of `ActiveRecord::ConnectionAdapters::Column::FALSE_VALUES`.
